Flame Demon
‚Ä¢ This boss will have 3 different attacks:
3x charges.
,
Jump charge followed immediately by random falling meteors.
,
Flame Shoot attack that will split into 6 smaller flames that spread outward.
,
(Typically this is the order of attacks, however, he can skip or repeat)

‚Ä¢ My method (like with most bosses) is to think of the triangle shape but the orientation does not matter.
-also after each movement, get one or two shots off, but never three, it‚Äôs too risky.
‚Ä¢ Using the triangle method imo is the best way to avoid his 3x charge. This will also keep him in close if you are using circle attack/runes. 
After movement, shoot shoot move.
‚Ä¢ Second attack is typically jump attack then immediate meteors. If you can get one shot off in between these attacks go for it, but not at the cost of eating a meteor.
After the meteors fall, shoot shoot move.
‚Ä¢ Lastly, you have the flame shot that splits into 6. The triangle method is perfect to avoid this because it may be a charge. Avoid the flame, possibly shoot, move to avoid the flame spread, shoot again.
Rinse and repeat

Stone Golem
‚Ä¢ This boss has 3 different attacks.
A rolling bowling boulder attack that eventually splits into 6. The big boulder will also track/follow.
,
(If this big boulder hits a wall, it will not split and will disappear)
A triple rock split.
,
(Edit)
Lastly, he also shoots 5 fast boulders at that are mostly guaranteed hits if you are close to him.
,
(If you freeze or paralyze him, he will never throw these)

‚Ä¢ This boss will always throw with his right arm.
‚Ä¢ My trick is to stand mostly in between him in the center and the wall. This is in the hopes when he tosses the boulder, it will cancel.
If it‚Äôs the triple rock split you‚Äôre still good to go.
,
‚Ä¢ The biggest point is to always rotate to dodge in a counterclockwise direction. This is to have to better chance of dodging the tosses.
If you dodge clockwise, you run a much bigger risk of taking a bolder or rock throw.
,
(edited)

Flame Demon
‚Ä¢ This boss will have 3 different attacks:
3x charges.
,
Jump charge followed immediately by random falling meteors.
,
Flame Shoot attack that will split into 6 smaller flames that spread outward.
,
(Typically this is the order of attacks, however, he can skip or repeat)

‚Ä¢ My method (like with most bosses) is to think of the triangle shape but the orientation does not matter.
-also after each movement, get one or two shots off, but never three, it‚Äôs too risky.
‚Ä¢ Using the triangle method imo is the best way to avoid his 3x charge. This will also keep him in close if you are using circle attack/runes. 
After movement, shoot shoot move.
‚Ä¢ Second attack is typically jump attack then immediate meteors. If you can get one shot off in between these attacks go for it, but not at the cost of eating a meteor.
After the meteors fall, shoot shoot move.
‚Ä¢ Lastly, you have the flame shot that splits into 6. The triangle method is perfect to avoid this because it may be a charge. Avoid the flame, possibly shoot, move to avoid the flame spread, shoot again.
Rinse and repeat

Stone Golem
‚Ä¢ This boss has 3 different attacks.
A rolling bowling boulder attack that eventually splits into 6. The big boulder will also track/follow.
,
(If this big boulder hits a wall, it will not split and will disappear)
A triple rock split.
,
(Edit)
Lastly, he also shoots 5 fast boulders at that are mostly guaranteed hits if you are close to him.
,
(If you freeze or paralyze him, he will never throw these)

‚Ä¢ This boss will always throw with his right arm.
‚Ä¢ My trick is to stand mostly in between him in the center and the wall. This is in the hopes when he tosses the boulder, it will cancel.
If it‚Äôs the triple rock split you‚Äôre still good to go.
,
‚Ä¢ The biggest point is to always rotate to dodge in a counterclockwise direction. This is to have to better chance of dodging the tosses.
If you dodge clockwise, you run a much bigger risk of taking a bolder or rock throw.
,
(edited)

For those following this chat and missed what was discussed in the dragoon set or rune enchantment channels... global crit damage is applied when an explosive meteors crits. The formula for calculating explosive meteor crit damage is as follows. 

(atk * atk multipliers) * (meteor multiplier) * (rune meteor damage multipliers) * dragoon helm multiplier * (explosion multiplier + global crit dmg and meteor crit dmg multipliers) (edited)

It's confusing because some things in the game are not worded properly. Anything that says crit +% with no specific damage type modifiers in front of it are typically considered to be global crit and anything that says "inherit character/owner crit" would use this number. The exceptions to this are oracle boots, spear, griffin helm and otta 2* which are all worded in a way that would imply global crit but what they really mean are main weapon crit (edited)

I've been doing some more testing for crit dmg formulas and am fairly confident I've been able to come up with the elemental crit damage formula. 

The base crit dmg for elements are +100% (twice the global base crit dmg percentage)

This base elemental crit dmg is additive with elemental crit dmg +% enchant and this is then separately additive with the inherited crit damage from elemental crit etched (edited)

The formula with the elemental etched is interesting because you get to utilize both the base elemental crit dmg of +100% and the base global crit dmg of +50%. The way the formula works with legendary elemental etched is...
((base elemental crit dmg multiplier + other elemental crit dmg multipliers) + ((base global crit dmg multiplier + other global crit dmg multipliers) * .3)) * elemental dmg (edited)

Legendary Archer
6/29/25, 11:41 PM
Sunday, June 29, 2025 at 11:41 PM
Warriors souls is 30%, so dracula is even better. Main weapon rune is not an ATK buff, those 30% will offset the penalty from Front Arrow.
So normally if you take Front Arrow it reduces damage of all your arrows by 15%, 2 Front Arrows will reduce it by 30% (so 70% of original arrow damage)
With 30% enchant you will start from 130% arrow damage and 2 Front Arrows will bring it down to 100%. This is separate from ATK buffs.

If you have other arena questions, feel free to ask here
,
What time should I play Arena every day?
,
,
I recommend 20-30 minutes before the daily reset.
This is because it prevents someone from sniping you and dropping you in the rankings after you have improved your rankings. And since the arena becomes unplayable 10 minutes before the daily reset, it is recommended to start playing 20-30 minutes before the reset.
You could save your tickets and use them all at once on the last day, but I don't know if I would recommend that since you would be wasting 5 tickets each day.
Does tickets stack?
,
,
Yes.
If you have 0-5 tickets when daily reset, it will reset to 5 tickets.
If you have 6 or more, the number won't change.
Every day, you can gain 3 more by doing daily tasks, 5 more by buying with gems, 50 more by buying with guild coins.
Regarding other modes, ‚Å†unknown
Is there a way to skip the battle?
,
,
The first option is to buy a monthly card.
 The second option is to press the pause button in the upper left corner right after the battle starts and leave the battle (the result will be reflected).
Which build should I use?
,
,
In arena, Dragoon set is recommended. 
However, many people concentrate on Oracle, so I have created a thread to discuss the rune build for Oracle users. ‚Å†[Check pinned msg] Arena Build‚Ä¶ (edited)

What is the best strategy when I'm stuck in my current group?
,
,
Deliberately demote one level and achieve a higher ranking in that group. 
Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted.
How exactly do I demote myself?
,
,
Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. 
The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. 
For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. 
For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3. ,
What time should I play Arena every day?
,
,
I recommend 20-30 minutes before the daily reset.
This is because it prevents someone from sniping you and dropping you in the rankings after you have improved your rankings. And since the arena becomes unplayable 10 minutes before the daily reset, it is recommended to start playing 20-30 minutes before the reset.
You could save your tickets and use them all at once on the last day, but I don't know if I would recommend that since you would be wasting 5 tickets each day.
Does tickets stack?
,
,
Yes.
If you have 0-5 tickets when daily reset, it will reset to 5 tickets.
If you have 6 or more, the number won't change.
Every day, you can gain 3 more by doing daily tasks, 5 more by buying with gems, 50 more by buying with guild coins.
Regarding other modes, ‚Å†unknown
Is there a way to skip the battle?
,
,
The first option is to buy a monthly card.
 The second option is to press the pause button in the upper left corner right after the battle starts and leave the battle (the result will be reflected).
Which build should I use?
,
,
In arena, Dragoon set is recommended. 
However, many people concentrate on Oracle, so I have created a thread to discuss the rune build for Oracle users. ‚Å†[Check pinned msg] Arena Build‚Ä¶ (edited)

What is the best strategy when I'm stuck in my current group?
,
,
Deliberately demote one level and achieve a higher ranking in that group. 
Specifically, check the ranking rewards, see if you would earn more if you dropped one group below you, and decide whether to stay in your current group or be demoted.
How exactly do I demote myself?
,
,
Keep your equipment off in preset and lower your power. Then play and lose. 
The way to check the rank to be demoted depends on the group. 
For those in the Supreme group, it is easy to see that you will be demoted if your ranking is lower than the displayed ranking. 
For those in the Diamond Master group, multiply the number of people being promoted by 3 and get below that rank. As shown in the picture above, the top 20% are promoted and the bottom 40% are demoted. Since the bottom 40% are below the top 60%, the number of those promoted (20%) should be multiplied by 3. (edited)

There were some tests results suggesting luck affects explosion chances (small sample size though), but since habby announced that 30% and 60% chances described in the game were wrong I can't ignore the fact that it could be just variance. Even if lucky shadow does boost DPS, the effect is minimal (like 1/5th or 1/10th of what a luck skill would provide) (edited)
Monday, July 14, 2025 at 6:31 AM

renox
Legendary Archer
OP
7/14/25, 6:49 AM
Monday, July 14, 2025 at 6:49 AM
For reference, epic lucky shadow boosted Lightwing proc chances from 27% to about 28%, so assuming it scales the same way for xbow, you'd get 2-4% Explo boost (depending on rune rarity) below Mythic xbow, and 3-6% boost for Mythic+. As explo dmg is likely to be 30-50% of all your dps, that's not a significant boost
